chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik P. Ahles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence Credit for 6 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs/surcharge.  Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.

No unsupervised contact with minors under the age of 18 except for his own minor children.
Register as a sex offender.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Erik P. Ahles in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Smith makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
Imposed Sentence of:
7 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 6 days )
5 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Register as a sex offender
No unsupervised contact with minors under the age of 18 except for his own minor children. 
Cost: $268.00 Bail to be applied 
DNA surcharge: $250.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by Atty Jonathan Smith, psychological evaluation by Dr. MIchael Woody
Sentencing hearing at 04-11-2016 10:30 am

Defendant Erik P. Ahles in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Court schedules this matter for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
